segment.source: Network security Force logoff when logon hours expire (Windows 10)
segment.target: Network security Force logoff when logon hours expire (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network security Force logoff when logon hours expire security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network security Force logoff when logon hours expire security policy setting.

segment.source: Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire
segment.target: Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire security policy setting.

segment.source: This security setting determines whether to disconnect users who are connected to the local device outside their user account's valid logon hours.
segment.target: This security setting determines whether to disconnect users who are connected to the local device outside their user account's valid logon hours.

segment.source: This setting affects the Server Message Block (SMB) component.
segment.target: This setting affects the Server Message Block (SMB) component.

segment.source: This policy setting does not apply to administrator accounts, but it behaves as an account policy.
segment.target: This policy setting does not apply to administrator accounts, but it behaves as an account policy.

segment.source: For domain accounts, there can be only one account policy.
segment.target: For domain accounts, there can be only one account policy.

segment.source: The account policy must be defined in the Default Domain Policy, and it is enforced by the domain controllers that make up the domain.
segment.target: The account policy must be defined in the Default Domain Policy, and it is enforced by the domain controllers that make up the domain.

segment.source: A domain controller always pulls the account policy from the Default Domain Policy Group Policy Object (GPO), even if there is a different account policy that is applied to the organizational unit that contains the domain controller.
segment.target: A domain controller always pulls the account policy from the Default Domain Policy Group Policy Object (GPO), even if there is a different account policy that is applied to the organizational unit that contains the domain controller.

segment.source: By default, workstations and servers that are joined to a domain (for example, member devices) also receive the same account policy for their local accounts.
segment.target: By default, workstations and servers that are joined to a domain (for example, member devices) also receive the same account policy for their local accounts.

segment.source: However, local account policies for member devices can be different from the domain account policy by defining an account policy for the organizational unit that contains the member devices.
segment.target: However, local account policies for member devices can be different from the domain account policy by defining an account policy for the organizational unit that contains the member devices.

segment.source: Kerberos settings are not applied to member devices.
segment.target: Kerberos settings are not applied to member devices.

segment.source: When enabled, this policy causes client sessions with the SMB server to be forcibly disconnected when the client's logon hours expire.
segment.target: When enabled, this policy causes client sessions with the SMB server to be forcibly disconnected when the client's logon hours expire.

segment.source: When disabled, this policy allows for the continuation of an established client session after the client's logon hours have expired.
segment.target: When disabled, this policy allows for the continuation of an established client session after the client's logon hours have expired.

segment.source: Set Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire to Enabled.
segment.target: Set Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire to Enabled.

segment.source: SMB sessions will be terminated on member servers when a user's logon time expires, and the user will be unable to log on to the system until their next scheduled access time begins.
segment.target: SMB sessions will be terminated on member servers when a user's logon time expires, and the user will be unable to log on to the system until their next scheduled access time begins.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: If you disable this policy setting, users can remain connected to the computer outside of their allotted logon hours.
segment.target: If you disable this policy setting, users can remain connected to the computer outside of their allotted logon hours.

segment.source: Enable the Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire setting.
segment.target: Enable the Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire setting.

segment.source: This policy setting does not apply to administrator accounts.
segment.target: This policy setting does not apply to administrator accounts.

segment.source: When a user's logon time expires, SMB sessions terminate.
segment.target: When a user's logon time expires, SMB sessions terminate.

segment.source: The user cannot log on to the device until the next scheduled access time commences.
segment.target: The user cannot log on to the device until the next scheduled access time commences.
